intro: Eriostemon anceps, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. It is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained environments. Its flowers bloom in spring and attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and birds.
